title: PHPceil()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPceil()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Round numbers up to the nearest integer: "); echo(ceil(0.40) . "
"); echo(ceil(5) . "
"); echo(ceil(5.1) . "
"); echo(ceil(-5.1) . "
"); echo(ceil(-5.9)); ?> Definition and Usage The ceil() function rounds a number UP to the nearest integer, if necessary. Tip: To round a number DOWN to the nearest integer, look at the floor() function. Tip: To round a floating-point number, look at the round() function. Syntax ceil( number ); Parameter Values Parameter Description number Required. Specifies the value to round up Technical Details Return Value: The value rounded up to the nearest integer Return Type: Float PHP Version: 4+ ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example

"); echo(ceil(0.40) . "

"); echo(ceil(5.1) . "
"); echo(ceil(-5.1) . "

summary: This tutorial covers PHPceil()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPceil()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPceil()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
